intro: Geonoma chapadensis, commonly known as the Brazilian fern, is a species of fern native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its delicate, lace-like fronds. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments, often in forest understories. Its rhizomes are creeping and produce both sterile and fertile fronds. The botanical features of Geonoma chapadensis make it an important component of tropical ecosystems.
